title: With His Pivot on Ukraine, Trump May Be Washing His Hands of the War
summary: President Trump has shown dwindling interest in mediating a peace accord, joining European “security guarantees” for Ukraine or providing aid and intelligence to the Ukrainians.

title: At U.N. Climate Summit, U.S. Stands Alone
summary: On Wednesday in New York, countries lined up to say they would accelerate their efforts to cut greenhouse-gas emissions. In staying away, the U.S. was all but alone.

title: At the UN, Trump Strikes Radically Different Tones in Public and Private
summary: At the United Nations, world leaders got to see both sides of President Trump: bellicose in public and far more conciliatory in private.

title: Dallas ICE Facility Shooting Leaves One Detainee Dead and Two Injured
summary: The shooter, who killed himself, also wounded two detainees in an attack that raised new fears about political violence in the United States.

title: JD Vance Spars With Jon Favreau Over Dallas Shooting Information
summary: In the aftermath of a violent episode, political figures quickly engaged with one another on social media.

title: Dallas Shooting Suspect Had Extensive Online Footprint but Little on Politics
summary: On social media accounts, the suspect, Joshua Jahn, talked about video games, cars, “South Park” and marijuana — but not so much about politics.

title: Immigrant Rights Groups Condemn Violent Rhetoric Against ICE and  Immigrants
summary: In a tense national debate, inflammatory language is being singled out.

title: U.S. Attorney Races to Present Case Against James Comey
summary: It remains to be seen whether a career prosecutor would be willing to present a case to a grand jury or whether jurors would bring an indictment.

title: Inquiry Into Ex-C.I.A. Chief Stalls After Purge by Gabbard
summary: The lack of an indictment so far against Mr. Brennan, in the Eastern District of Pennsylvania, is the most recent setback for such prosecutions.

title: Trump Administration Eyes More Mass Layoffs if Government Shuts Down
summary: The president’s top aides told agencies to prepare for potential firings if Congress cannot extend funding before the end of Sept. 30.

title: Jimmy Kimmel’s Return Draws 6.2 Million Viewers, Ratings Show
summary: The first episode of “Jimmy Kimmel Live!” since it was suspended last week by Disney attracted nearly four times its average viewership.

title: How Did Maria Branyas Morera, Who Was the World’s Oldest Person, Live So Long?
summary: Spanish researchers say Maria Branyas Morera, who lived to 117, won a genetic lottery. But experts caution that healthy genes and microbiomes don’t explain longevity on their own.

title: At a Times Event, Opposing Views on Climate Change Collide
summary: In a day of live journalism, California’s governor assailed President Trump, and the U.S. energy secretary called for countries to quit the Paris Agreement on global warming.

title: With Sobs and Doubts, Greenlandic Women Receive Apology for Forced Contraception
summary: Some Greenlanders asked why an apology had not come decades earlier, and chalked up the timing to tensions over President Trump’s aim of annexing the island.

title: Kashmir’s Apple Harvest Rots After Landslide Blocks Road
summary: The Himalayan region supplies most of India’s apples. But when heavy rains left a major highway blocked for weeks, farmers couldn’t get them to markets.

title: A Curator Flees Bangkok After China Deems His Art Show Too Provocative
summary: A museum’s directors said Chinese and Thai officials pressured them to remove the names of artists whose works criticized China. The curator flew to London, fearing arrest.

title: Mel Taub, Creator of a Pun-Loving Puzzle, Is Dead at 97
summary: He was the main whiz behind a crossword  variation for The Times, whose readers delighted in his anagrams and sometimes groan-inducing wordplay. (Try one yourself.)

title: President Trump, Your Aid Cuts Are Costing Lives and Money
summary: The dismantling of U.S.A.I.D. is leading to the squandering of taxpayer dollars, as well as of large numbers of lives.

title: Trump Is Building the Blue Scare
summary: The political theorist Corey Robin walks through the history of the Red Scare and the “fractured mirror” it is to Trump’s attack on the “radical left.”

title: A Shooter Opened Fire on a Dallas ICE Facility
summary: Also, we answer your vaccine questions. Here’s the latest at the end of Wednesday.

title: A Flash of Anger on India’s Delicate Border With China
summary: Protesters demanding statehood for Ladakh, a strategically important Himalayan region, clashed with the police.

title: Woman, 50, Killed by Midtown Manhattan Driver in Hit-and-Run Crash
summary: A driver hit the woman and her husband, tourists from Germany, near Bryant Park on Wednesday afternoon. Her husband, 55, was injured, the police said.

title: Akiko Tsuruga, Inventive Jazz Organist, Dies at 58
summary: Known for her vast sonic palette, she made her mark playing with the saxophone master Lou Donaldson and also had a prolific solo career.

title: Want to Bring a Dog to This Italian City? That Will Be $1.75.
summary: Bolzano, in northern Italy, is considering taxing tourists’ dogs, and charging resident dog owners an annual fee as well.
